00028 #include <string.h>                                              // for size_t
00029 #include "hal.h"
00030 
00031 #include <windows.h>            // for Windows serial communication facilities
00032 #include <stdio.h>
00033 #include <conio.h>
00034 
00035 //............................................................................
00036 static HANDLE l_com;
00037 static COMMTIMEOUTS l_timeouts;
00038 
00039 #define BUF_SIZE 1024
00040 #define COM_SETTINGS \
00041     "baud=%d parity=N data=8 stop=1 odsr=off dtr=on octs=off rts=on"
00042 
00043 //............................................................................
00044 bool comOpen(char const *comName, int baudRate) {
00045     DCB dcb = {0};
00046     char comSettings[120];
00047 
00048     l_com = 0;
00049     sprintf(comSettings,
00050             COM_SETTINGS,
00051             baudRate);
00052 
00053     l_com = CreateFile(comName,
00054                          GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE,
00055                          0,                                // exclusive access
00056                          NULL,                            // no security attrs
00057                          OPEN_EXISTING,
00058                          0,                   // standard (not-overlapped) I/O
00059                          NULL);
00060 
00061     if (l_com == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
00062         printf("Error by opening the COM port: %s at the baud rate %d\n",
00063                comName, baudRate);
00064         return false;
00065     }
00066 
00067     dcb.DCBlength = sizeof(DCB);
00068     if (!GetCommState(l_com, &dcb)) {
00069         printf("Error by retreiving port settings\n");
00070         return (HANDLE)0;
00071     }
00072 
00073     dcb.fAbortOnError = 0;                             // don't abort on error
00074     // Fill in the DCB
00075     if (!BuildCommDCB(comSettings, &dcb)) {
00076         printf("Error by parsing command line parameters\n");
00077         return false;
00078     }
00079 
00080     if (!SetCommState(l_com, &dcb)) {
00081         printf("Error setting up the port\n");
00082         return false;
00083     }
00084 
00085     SetupComm(l_com, BUF_SIZE, BUF_SIZE);        // setup the device buffers
00086 
00087     // purge any information in the buffers
00088     PurgeComm(l_com, PURGE_TXABORT | PURGE_RXABORT |
00089                      PURGE_TXCLEAR | PURGE_RXCLEAR);
00090 
00091     // the timeouts for the serial communication are set accorging to the
00092     // following remark from the Win32 help documentation:
00093     //
00094     // If an application sets ReadIntervalTimeout and
00095     // ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier to MAXDWORD and sets
00096     // ReadTotalTimeoutConstant to a value greater than zero and less than
00097     // MAXDWORD, one of the following occurs when the ReadFile function
00098     // is called:
00099     // 1. If there are any characters in the input buffer, ReadFile
00100     // returns immediately with the characters in the buffer.
00101     // 2. If there are no characters in the input buffer, ReadFile waits
00102     // until a character arrives and then returns immediately.
00103     // 3. If no character arrives within the time specified by
00104     // ReadTotalTimeoutConstant, ReadFile times out.
00105     //
00106     l_timeouts.ReadIntervalTimeout = MAXDWORD;
00107     l_timeouts.ReadTotalTimeoutMultiplier = MAXDWORD;
00108     l_timeouts.ReadTotalTimeoutConstant = 50;
00109     l_timeouts.WriteTotalTimeoutMultiplier = 0;
00110     l_timeouts.WriteTotalTimeoutConstant = 50;
00111     SetCommTimeouts(l_com, &l_timeouts);
00112 
00113     return true;                                                    // success
00114 }
00115 //............................................................................
00116 void comClose(void) {
00117     CloseHandle(l_com);
00118 }
00119 //............................................................................
00120 int comRead(unsigned char *buf, size_t size) {
00121     DWORD n;
00122     if (!ReadFile(l_com, buf, (DWORD)size, &n, NULL)) {
00123         printf("*** Reading serial port failed; GetLastError=%ld\n",
00124                GetLastError());
00125         DWORD errors;
00126         COMSTAT comstat;
00127         ClearCommError(l_com, &errors, &comstat);
00128     }
00129     if (_kbhit()) {
00130         return -1;                                                // terminate
00131     }
00132     return (int)n;
00133 }
